q: ( Reuters)- Chrysler is working to refinance what its chief executive characterized as "shyster loans" that the Obama administration extended as part of a bailout to keep the automaker from collapse in 2009. I want to pay back the shyster loans, Sergio Marchionne said at an industry conference, using a derogatory term for an unprincipled lawyer or politician. "Pay back the loans, get those out and then take( the company) public." Sergio Marchionne

"I think our presence in Chrysler could not have been forecast, and certainly in hindsight it was probably one of the best things that could have happened to Fiat," he said last week in Italy.
